pages.title: Redstone Controller
pages.text: Lua-controlled $(thing)wireless redstone$() via Create's Redstone Link frequency system. Transmit and receive redstone signals on any frequency channel from code.$(br2)Peripheral type: $(thing)"redstone_controller"$()
Channels use two item IDs as the frequency pair, matching Create's Redstone Link system.

pages.title: Lua API
pages.text: $(li)$(thing)setOutput(item1, item2, power)$() — transmit signal (0-15) on channel$(br)$(li)$(thing)getInput(item1, item2)$() → int — received signal on channel$(br)$(li)$(thing)getOutput(item1, item2)$() → int — current transmit power$(br)$(li)$(thing)removeChannel(item1, item2)$() — remove a channel$(br)$(li)$(thing)getChannels()$() → [{item1, item2, mode, power}]$(br)$(li)$(thing)setAllOutputs(power)$() — set all transmit channels$(br)$(li)$(thing)clearChannels()$() — remove all channels$(br)$(li)$(thing)getPosition()$() → {x, y, z}

pages.title: Usage Examples
pages.text: $(bold)Toggle a door:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)local rc = peripheral.find("redstone_controller")$(br)rc.setOutput($(br)  "minecraft:redstone",$(br)  "minecraft:redstone", 15)$()$(br2)$(bold)Read a sensor:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)local power = rc.getInput($(br)  "minecraft:iron_ingot",$(br)  "minecraft:gold_ingot")$(br)print("Signal: " .. power)$()$(br2)Frequency pairs match Create's Redstone Links — any two item IDs form a channel.
